alert.note: Alert for Chase; Frontier; Hayes; Lincoln (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 11 at 2:14PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of central Nebraska, Panhandle of Nebraska and southwest Nebraska, including the following counties, in central Nebraska, Custer. In the Panhandle of Nebraska, Deuel, Garden and Sheridan. In southwest Nebraska, Chase, Frontier, Hayes, Keith, Lincoln and Perkins. * WHEN...Through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Thunderstorms will increase again this afternoon into this evening with local rainfall rates over one inch per hour possible. Some of these storms will track across similar areas through the evening hours producing heavy rainfall. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
